ResumeParserData.Summary: Industrial and Mechanical Engineer interested in new opportunities as a Quality Assurance and/or Engineering Lead. Versatile, and adaptable professional with leadership experience ranging from small scale research firms, to large Corporations. Worked in the Nogales area for many years. Engineering expert and Quality Assurance proficient in ISO 9001 and ISO 13485 Quality Systems, conducted product safety 2nd. and 3rd party ISO Quality system audits for 15+ years, worked in the manufacturing of commercial electronic product, car engines, as well as medical devices, Research and Development, Product Engineering, Regulatory and Product Compliance Agencies supported by 20+ years of experience with the confidence and the ability to oversee and manage small, medium or large teams of professionals while ensuring timely completion of projects. Dual citizenship (U.S. and Mexico) . Bilingual and fluent in both English and Spanish.Engineering Leader & Research and Development Manager 			  March 2012 -   Vante Inc. A division of Machine Solutions Inc.	  February 2018   Tucson, AZ   Responsible for leading and coordinating the activities related to product engineering, sustaining engineering, research and development, new product introduction, working in partnership with Executive Management, Operations, Quality, and Sales Departments.    In charge of the design, risk management, validation and verification processes for new products development and market introduction, and the evaluation of changes due to components obsolescence that may affect fit, form or function.   Lead and managed the Research and Development (R&D) team creating a favorable environment to stimulate creativity and innovation, ensuring that the Engineering personnel has the skills, resources and follow proper methods to succeed in meeting the R&D goals, product quality, functionality, marketing schedule, and cost following the company ISO 9001/13485 Quality System.   Conducted Quality Improvement on daily production, assembly and repair issues, process improvements, failure analysis, customer complaints, supplier issues (scorecards, evaluations, and selection) , authoring testing plans and procedures, represented Engineering and managed an effective customer complaint resolution process following the QSM internal procedures, internal audits, Engineering changes, quality and technical training coordination, Material Review Board (MRB) , and improving company QSM 13485.   Operated closely with other functional areas to ensure that the deliverables of product development were aligned with the company's business plans, quality policies, released assembly and testing procedures, as well as customer and marketing commitments.   Participated in divisional monthly and quarterly Hoshin Kanri (strategic planning) meetings with key leadership personnel.   Lead daily stand-up meetings and weekly Gemba walks with company leadership as part of lean manufacturing efforts to support continuous improvement activities and company yearly goals.      Product Engineer 			  March 2011 -   Vante Inc. 		  			  March 2012   Tucson, AZ  	   Led activities related to the material review board (MRB) providing continual technical support to suppliers, engineering change orders (ECR and ECO) , corrective, production floor support promoting continuous improvement initiatives for processes, testing and documentation, corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) , product complaint investigations,  testing and evaluations due to electronic components obsolescence and for regulatory and	  safety compliance, in charge of the product safety inspections conducted by TUV SUD twice a year.  	   Member of the internal auditor's team for ISO 13485 : 2003.   	  Senior Manufacturing Engineer 			  November 2009 -   Haemonetics Corporation 			  March 2011   Salt Lake City, UT   Facilitated post-purchase transfer of production and testing lines, IQ/OQ/PQ validation efforts, as well as the training and start-up operation of the blood collection division acquired from Sebra-Tucson to the Salt Lake City, UT facility.   Supported and assisted the efforts of Haemonetics headquarters (Braintree, MA.) to upgrade and integrate Sebra's product line into Haemonetics Document Control System and 13485 Quality System.   Member of MRB, CAPA, and product safety and regulatory compliance teams.      Quality Control & Product Testing Manager 		March 2006 -   SEBRA Engineering & Research Associates 		November 2009   Tucson, AZ   Responsible for the product quality throughout the manufacturing processes providing quality leadership and guidance to different Sebra's teams.   Organized and promoted quality improvement efforts helping to interpret and implementing the ISO 13485 and customer specifications.   Verified through inspections and testing that the company's products met and/or exceed set specifications.    Directed incoming inspections, in-process verification, final inspection and testing of the product.	    Responsible for the measurement, data analysis, implementation of process improvements, as well as development and support to new suppliers to ensure compliance to FDA 21 CFR 820 , ISO 13485 : 2003 , SEBRA's QSM and other regulatory agencies.    Supervised testing requirements for EN (CE) Low Voltage and EMC Directives.   Evaluated inspection / test data and created key performance indicators (KPI) for leadership analysis.   Developed and maintained supplier partnerships satisfying both scheduling and quality requirements. Maintained direct contact with Sales, Assembly, Purchasing and Shipping / Receiving to be aware of shipping priorities and factory commitments.    Assisted Sales and Marketing team with customers in Latin America, Brazil and Portugal.    Reviewed technical problems and departmental procedures, recommending solutions to problems or changes in procedures to address non-conformance to specifications.   In charge of searching, assessing, recommending, selecting and co-developing strategic partnerships with new suppliers in Mexico with a focus in costs reduction (30 %+) while maintaining a good quality product.   Designated by top management to facilitate and create a more efficient interaction and improve our submissions with regulatory agencies (TUV, CSA, UL, and FDA) , in order to decrease time approvals, testing and factory inspections costs.    SEBRA's Member of the internal auditor's group for FDA and ISO 13485 : 2003.      SR. Project Manager for New Products Introduction and Engineering 		May 2004 -   The Chamberlin Group Inc.  		August 2005   Nogales, Mexico   Responsible for managing all new and cost reduction projects assigned ensuring that the Chamberlain-PACE processes and ISO 9000 requirements were fulfilled. Ensuring all critical milestones, budget targets and product requirements were met or exceeded. Establish multi-functional core team regular meetings to gain commitments on action items and completion dates.   Communicated all critical project information to team, functional members, stakeholders and CGI committees. Ensured all factory capacity, O/T requirements, learning curve / efficiency losses, product and equipment cost implications were addressed.   Coordinated and managed project schedule and work with appropriate groups in Manufacturing, Materials, Quality, Purchasing, and Design to develop recovery plans when needed.   Managed capital and expense forecast.   Prepared monthly summary reports covering all related activities.      Area Manager / Coordinator and Field Representative 		October 2000 -   Underwriters Laboratories Inc.  			  March 2003   Nogales, AZ 			  and     		 October 1986 -   Took an 18-month sabbatical to increase knowledge in high volume operations at SL Waber Inc. 			  March 1999    	 	  Led a team of Engineers, and managed the logistics, coordination, inspections and audits of ~100 factories.   Conducted factory inspections to check the means used by the Manufacturer to determine that their products continued to meet the applicable safety requirements using UL procedures, UL Standards and mechanical and/or electrical testing on samples selected from the production line or factory stock.    In depth knowledge of plastic specifications, molding, power supply cords, wiring harnesses, information technology equipment, power supplies, surge suppressors, transformers, fabrication, assembly, inspection and testing.   In charge of conducting routine Quality System audits for several European agencies such as VDE (Germany) , SEMKO (SWEDEN) , IMQ (ITALY) , under the Secretariat held by the EEPCA European Electrical Products Certification Association . Audits were conducted using ISO 9000 standards.      Director of Quality Assurance 			  March 1999 -   SL Waber 			  September 2000   Nogales, AZ   In charge of providing technical quality engineering support to the operation of 2 manufacturing plants (Nogales, Arizona and Nogales, Mexico) dedicated to produce electronic surge suppressors and temporary power taps.   Coordinated all aspects of the quality assurance program towards design, APQP, development and implementation of a process oriented to the alignment of ISO 9000 compliance, as well as the coordinating efforts to improve inprocess and final product first pass rates.   Responsible for providing training of ISO 9000 compliance, SPC, 8 Disciplines (8Ds) , and continuous improvement (Kaizen) techniques to organization.   Responsible for providing support and direction to decrease the discrepancies' rate and challenges with several safety agencies such as UL, CSA, TUV, etc.   Managed and coordinated the acquisition of new products brought to our facilities in Arizona and Mexico as well as quality evaluations for potential new suppliers.   Developed, monitored, and reported key quality metrics to Top Management.   Responsible for managing and leading Engineering Department as part of a cross training program.      Professional Development, Continued Education and Certifications   Medical Device Risk Management (ISO   14791 : 2007)  Safety of Machinery (ISO 12100)  Quality Management (ISO 9001 and 13485)  Internal Auditing Techniques   Understanding UL/EN 61010-1 Laboratory Equipment-Regulatory Requirements    Understanding UL/EN/IEC 60601-1 Medical Electrical Equipment-Regulatory Requirements   Low Voltage Directive requirements   8 Disciplines (8D) -Problem solving	    FDA CFR 820 Part 21 Proficient   Lean Six Sigma   Lean Manufacturing    Hoshin Kanri Policy Deployment   Kaizen Continuous Improvement   Value Stream Mapping   Kaizen-Blitz Proficient   5S, 7S, Lean Manufacturing    Root Cause Analysis, 5 Whys   Corrective and Preventive actions   Quality Engineering-Taguchi Methods   Core Team Training-PACE Project Management   7 Habits of Highly Effective People-Stephen Covey Institute

ResumeParserData.DetailResume:
TITAN TECHNOLOGIES Inc.

Gerry Guardiola

Personal Summary 
Industrial and Mechanical Engineer interested in new opportunities as a Quality Assurance and/or Engineering Lead. Versatile, and adaptable professional with leadership experience ranging from small scale research firms, to large Corporations. Worked in the Nogales area for many years. Engineering expert and Quality Assurance proficient in ISO 9001 and ISO 13485 Quality Systems, conducted product safety 2nd. and 3rd party ISO Quality system audits for 15+ years, worked in the manufacturing of commercial electronic product, car engines, as well as medical devices, Research and Development, Product Engineering, Regulatory and Product Compliance Agencies supported by 20+ years of experience with the confidence and the ability to oversee and manage small, medium or large teams of professionals while ensuring timely completion of projects. Dual citizenship (U.S. and Mexico) . Bilingual and fluent in both English and Spanish.  
 
Professional Summary 
 
Engineering Leader & Research and Development Manager 			  March 2012 - 
Vante Inc. A division of Machine Solutions Inc.	  February 2018 
Tucson, AZ 
Responsible for leading and coordinating the activities related to product engineering, sustaining engineering, research and development, new product introduction, working in partnership with Executive Management, Operations, Quality, and Sales Departments.  
In charge of the design, risk management, validation and verification processes for new products development and market introduction, and the evaluation of changes due to components obsolescence that may affect fit, form or function. 
Lead and managed the Research and Development (R&D) team creating a favorable environment to stimulate creativity and innovation, ensuring that the Engineering personnel has the skills, resources and follow proper methods to succeed in meeting the R&D goals, product quality, functionality, marketing schedule, and cost following the company ISO 9001/13485 Quality System. 
Conducted Quality Improvement on daily production, assembly and repair issues, process improvements, failure analysis, customer complaints, supplier issues (scorecards, evaluations, and selection) , authoring testing plans and procedures, represented Engineering and managed an effective customer complaint resolution process following the QSM internal procedures, internal audits, Engineering changes, quality and technical training coordination, Material Review Board (MRB) , and improving company QSM 13485. 
Operated closely with other functional areas to ensure that the deliverables of product development were aligned with the company's business plans, quality policies, released assembly and testing procedures, as well as customer and marketing commitments. 
Participated in divisional monthly and quarterly Hoshin Kanri (strategic planning) meetings with key leadership personnel. 
Lead daily stand-up meetings and weekly Gemba walks with company leadership as part of lean manufacturing efforts to support continuous improvement activities and company yearly goals. 
 
Product Engineer 			  March 2011 - 
Vante Inc. 		  			  March 2012 
Tucson, AZ  	 
Led activities related to the material review board (MRB) providing continual technical support to suppliers, engineering change orders (ECR and ECO) , corrective, production floor support promoting continuous improvement initiatives for processes, testing and documentation, corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) , product complaint investigations,  testing and evaluations due to electronic components obsolescence and for regulatory and	  safety compliance, in charge of the product safety inspections conducted by TUV SUD twice a year.  	 
Member of the internal auditor's team for ISO 13485 : 2003. 
	
Senior Manufacturing Engineer 			  November 2009 - 
Haemonetics Corporation 			  March 2011 
Salt Lake City, UT 
Facilitated post-purchase transfer of production and testing lines, IQ/OQ/PQ validation efforts, as well as the training and start-up operation of the blood collection division acquired from Sebra-Tucson to the Salt Lake City, UT facility. 
Supported and assisted the efforts of Haemonetics headquarters' (Braintree, MA.) to upgrade and integrate Sebra's product line into Haemonetics Document Control System and 13485 Quality System. 
Member of MRB, CAPA, and product safety and regulatory compliance teams. 
 
Quality Control & Product Testing Manager 		March 2006 - 
SEBRA Engineering & Research Associates 		November 2009 
Tucson, AZ 
Responsible for the product quality throughout the manufacturing processes providing quality leadership and guidance to different Sebra's teams. 
Organized and promoted quality improvement efforts helping to interpret and implementing the ISO 13485 and customer specifications. 
Verified through inspections and testing that the company's products met and/or exceed set specifications.  
Directed incoming inspections, in-process verification, final inspection and testing of the product.	  
Responsible for the measurement, data analysis, implementation of process improvements, as well as development and support to new suppliers to ensure compliance to FDA 21 CFR 820 , ISO 13485 : 2003 , SEBRA's QSM and other regulatory agencies.  
Supervised testing requirements for EN (CE) Low Voltage and EMC Directives. 
Evaluated inspection/test data and created key performance indicators (KPI) for leadership analysis. 
Developed and maintained supplier partnerships satisfying both scheduling and quality requirements. Maintained direct contact with Sales, Assembly, Purchasing and Shipping/Receiving to be aware of shipping priorities and factory commitments.  
Assisted Sales and Marketing team with customers in Latin America, Brazil and Portugal.  
Reviewed technical problems and departmental procedures, recommending solutions to problems or changes in procedures to address non-conformance to specifications. 
In charge of searching, assessing, recommending, selecting and co-developing strategic partnerships with new suppliers in Mexico with a focus in costs reduction (30 %+) while maintaining a good quality product. 
Designated by top management to facilitate and create a more efficient interaction and improve our submissions with regulatory agencies (TUV, CSA, UL, and FDA) , in order to decrease time approvals, testing and factory inspections costs.  
SEBRA's Member of the internal auditors group for FDA and ISO 13485 : 2003. 
 
SR. Project Manager for New Products Introduction and Engineering 		May 2004 - 
The Chamberlin Group Inc.  		August 2005 
Nogales, Mexico 
Responsible for managing all new and cost reduction projects assigned ensuring that the Chamberlain-PACE processes and ISO 9000 requirements were fulfilled. Ensuring all critical milestones, budget targets and product requirements were met or exceeded. Establish multi-functional core team regular meetings to gain commitments on action items and completion dates. 
Communicated all critical project information to team, functional members, stakeholders and CGI committees. Ensured all factory capacity, O/T requirements, learning curve/efficiency losses, product and equipment cost implications were addressed. 
Coordinated and managed project schedule and work with appropriate groups in Manufacturing, Materials, Quality, Purchasing, and Design to develop recovery plans when needed. 
Managed capital and expense forecast. 
Prepared monthly summary reports covering all related activities. 
 
Area Manager/Coordinator and Field Representative 		October 2000 - 
Underwriters Laboratories Inc.  			  March 2003 
Nogales, AZ 			  And  
 		 October 1986 - 
Took an 18-month sabbatical to increase knowledge in high volume operations at SL Waber Inc. 			  March 1999 
 	 	
Led a team of Engineers, and managed the logistics, coordination, inspections and audits of ~100 factories. 
Conducted factory inspections to check the means used by the Manufacturer to determine that their products continued to meet the applicable safety requirements using UL procedures, UL Standards and mechanical and/or electrical testing on samples selected from the production line or factory stock.  
In depth knowledge of plastic specifications, molding, power supply cords, wiring harnesses, information technology equipment, power supplies, surge suppressors, transformers, fabrication, assembly, inspection and testing. 
In charge of conducting routine Quality System audits for several European agencies such as VDE (Germany) , SEMKO (SWEDEN) , IMQ (ITALY) , under the Secretariat held by the EEPCA European Electrical Products Certification Association . Audits were conducted using ISO 9000 standards. 
 
Director of Quality Assurance 			  March 1999 - 
SL Waber 			  September 2000 
Nogales, AZ 
In charge of providing technical quality engineering support to the operation of 2 manufacturing plants (Nogales, Arizona and Nogales, Mexico) dedicated to produce electronic surge suppressors and temporary power taps. 
Coordinated all aspects of the quality assurance program towards design, APQP, development and implementation of a process oriented to the alignment of ISO 9000 compliance, as well as the coordinating efforts to improve inprocess and final product first pass rates. 
Responsible for providing training of ISO 9000 compliance, SPC, 8 Disciplines (8Ds) , and continuous improvement (Kaizen) techniques to organization. 
Responsible for providing support and direction to decrease the discrepancies' rate and challenges with several safety agencies such as UL, CSA, TUV, etc. 
Managed and coordinated the acquisition of new products brought to our facilities in Arizona and Mexico as well as quality evaluations for potential new suppliers. 
Developed, monitored, and reported key quality metrics to Top Management. 
Responsible for managing and leading Engineering Department as part of a cross training program. 
 
Professional Development, Continued Education and Certifications 
Medical Device Risk Management (ISO 
14791 : 2007) 
Safety of Machinery (ISO 12100) 
Quality Management (ISO 9001 & 13485) 
Internal Auditing Techniques 
Understanding UL/EN 61010-1 Laboratory Equipment-Regulatory Requirements  
Understanding UL/EN/IEC 60601-1 Medical Electrical Equipment-Regulatory Requirements 
Low Voltage Directive requirements 
8 Disciplines (8D) -Problem solving	  
FDA CFR 820 Part 21 Proficient 
Lean Six Sigma 
Lean Manufacturing  
Hoshin Kanri Policy Deployment 
Kaizen Continuous Improvement 
Value Stream Mapping 
Kaizen-Blitz Proficient 
5S, 7S, Lean Manufacturing  
Root Cause Analysis, 5 Whys 
Corrective and Preventive actions 
Quality Engineering-Taguchi Methods 
Core Team Training-PACE Project Management 
7 Habits of Highly Effective People-Stephen Covey Institute 
Personal Development - Dale Carnegie 
PPAP, APQP, FMEA-Ford Motor Company 
Courses on Marketing, MBA & Finances for Engineers 
Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) 
SolidWorks-3DVIA COMPOSER 
Leadership Fundamentals-Barry-Wehmiller University 
Communication Skills (DISC) -Barry-Wehmiller University 
ASQ Certified Quality Engineer 
Internal Quality Auditor (ISO 13485 : 2003) 
Education 
BS Engineering	  
Major - Mechanical Engineering 
Minor - Design, and Thermoelectric power plants 
Ranked 3rd in Class 
Chihuahua Technological Institute 
Chihuahua, Mexico 
 
Professional Organizations 
 • Society of manufacturing Engineers (SME) Member

TITAN TECHNOLOGIES Inc.	  Phone : 1-888-671-6649  	www.titan-techs.com
ResumeParserData.HtmlResume:
Gerry Guardiola

 

Personal Summary

Industrial and Mechanical Engineer interested in new opportunities as a Quality Assurance and/or Engineering Lead. Versatile, and adaptable professional with leadership experience ranging from small scale research firms, to large Corporations.  Worked in the Nogales area for many years. Engineering expert and Quality Assurance proficient in ISO 9001 and ISO 13485 Quality Systems, conducted product safety 2nd. and 3rd party ISO Quality system audits for 15+ years, worked in the manufacturing of commercial electronic product, car engines, as well as medical devices, Research and Development, Product Engineering, Regulatory and Product Compliance Agencies supported by 20+ years of experience with the confidence and the ability to oversee and manage small, medium or large teams of professionals while ensuring timely completion of projects.  Dual citizenship (U.S. and Mexico) . Bilingual and fluent in both English and Spanish. 

 

Professional Summary

 

Engineering Leader & Research and Development Manager        March 2012 -

Vante Inc. A division of Machine Solutions Inc. February 2018

Tucson, AZ

  • Responsible for leading and coordinating the activities related to product engineering, sustaining engineering, research and development, new product introduction, working in partnership with Executive Management, Operations, Quality, and Sales Departments. 
  • In charge of the design, risk management, validation and verification processes for new products development and market introduction, and the evaluation of changes due to components obsolescence that may affect fit, form or function.
  • Lead and managed the Research and Development (R&D) team creating a favorable environment to stimulate creativity and innovation, ensuring that the Engineering personnel has the skills, resources and follow proper methods to succeed in meeting the R&D goals, product quality, functionality, marketing schedule, and cost following the company ISO 9001/13485 Quality System.
  • Conducted Quality Improvement on daily production, assembly and repair issues, process improvements, failure analysis, customer complaints, supplier issues (scorecards, evaluations, and selection) , authoring testing plans and procedures, represented Engineering and managed an effective customer complaint resolution process following the QSM internal procedures, internal audits, Engineering changes, quality and technical training coordination, Material Review Board (MRB) , and improving company QSM 13485.
  • Operated closely with other functional areas to ensure that the deliverables of product development were aligned with the company's business plans, quality policies, released assembly and testing procedures, as well as customer and marketing commitments.
  • Participated in divisional monthly and quarterly Hoshin Kanri (strategic planning) meetings with key leadership personnel.
  • Lead daily stand-up meetings and weekly Gemba walks with company leadership as part of lean manufacturing efforts to support continuous improvement activities and company yearly goals.

 

Product Engineer             March 2011 -

Vante Inc.               March 2012

Tucson, AZ   

  • Led activities related to the material review board (MRB) providing continual technical  support to suppliers, engineering change orders (ECR and ECO) , corrective, production floor  support promoting continuous improvement initiatives for processes, testing and  documentation, corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) , product complaint investigations,  testing and evaluations due to electronic components obsolescence and for regulatory and safety compliance, in charge of the product safety inspections conducted by TUV SUD twice  a year.   
  • Member of the internal auditor's team for ISO 13485:2003.

 

Senior Manufacturing Engineer          November 2009 -

Haemonetics Corporation            March 2011

Salt Lake City, UT

  • Facilitated post-purchase transfer of production and testing lines, IQ/OQ/PQ validation efforts, as well as the training and start-up operation of the blood collection division acquired from Sebra-Tucson to the Salt Lake City, UT facility.
  • Supported and assisted the efforts of Haemonetics headquarters' (Braintree, MA.) to upgrade and integrate Sebra's product line into Haemonetics Document Control System and 13485 Quality System.
  • Member of MRB, CAPA, and product safety and regulatory compliance teams.

 

Quality Control & Product Testing Manager         March 2006 -

SEBRA Engineering & Research Associates         November 2009

Tucson, AZ

  • Responsible for the product quality throughout the manufacturing processes providing quality leadership and guidance to different Sebra's teams.
  • Organized and promoted quality improvement efforts helping to interpret and implementing the ISO 13485 and customer specifications.
  • Verified through inspections and testing that the company's products met and/or exceed set specifications. 
  • Directed incoming inspections, in-process verification, final inspection and testing of the product.
  • Responsible for the measurement, data analysis, implementation of process improvements, as well as development and support to new suppliers to ensure compliance to FDA 21 CFR 820, ISO 13485:2003, SEBRA's QSM and other regulatory agencies. 
  • Supervised testing requirements for EN (CE) Low Voltage and EMC Directives.
  • Evaluated inspection/test data and created key performance indicators (KPI) for leadership analysis.
  • Developed and maintained supplier partnerships satisfying both scheduling and quality requirements. Maintained direct contact with Sales, Assembly, Purchasing and Shipping/Receiving to be aware of shipping priorities and factory commitments. 
  • Assisted Sales and Marketing team with customers in Latin America, Brazil and Portugal. 
  • Reviewed technical problems and departmental procedures, recommending solutions to problems or changes in procedures to address non-conformance to specifications.
  • In charge of searching, assessing, recommending, selecting and co-developing strategic partnerships with new suppliers in Mexico with a focus in costs reduction (30 %+) while maintaining a good quality product.
  • Designated by top management to facilitate and create a more efficient interaction and improve our submissions with regulatory agencies (TUV, CSA, UL, and FDA) , in order to decrease time approvals, testing and factory inspections costs. 
  • SEBRA's Member of the internal auditors group for FDA and ISO 13485:2003.

 

SR. Project Manager for New Products Introduction and Engineering     May 2004 -

The Chamberlin Group Inc.            August 2005

Nogales, Mexico

  • Responsible for managing all new and cost reduction projects assigned ensuring that the Chamberlain-PACE processes and ISO 9000 requirements were fulfilled. Ensuring all critical milestones, budget targets and product requirements were met or exceeded. Establish multi-functional core team regular meetings to gain commitments on action items and completion dates.
  • Communicated all critical project information to team, functional members, stakeholders and CGI committees. Ensured all factory capacity, O/T requirements, learning curve / efficiency losses, product and equipment cost implications were addressed.
  • Coordinated and managed project schedule and work with appropriate groups in Manufacturing, Materials, Quality, Purchasing, and Design to develop recovery plans when needed.
  • Managed capital and expense forecast.
  • Prepared monthly summary reports covering all related activities.

 

Area Manager / Coordinator and Field Representative       October 2000 -

Underwriters Laboratories Inc.             March 2003

Nogales, AZ             And 

               October 1986 -

Took an 18-month sabbatical to increase knowledge in high volume operations at SL Waber Inc.    March 1999

    

  • Led a team of Engineers, and managed the logistics, coordination, inspections and audits of ~100 factories.
  • Conducted factory inspections to check the means used by the Manufacturer to determine that their products continued to meet the applicable safety requirements using UL procedures, UL Standards and mechanical and/or electrical testing on samples selected from the production line or factory stock. 
  • In depth knowledge of plastic specifications, molding, power supply cords, wiring harnesses, information technology equipment, power supplies, surge suppressors, transformers, fabrication, assembly, inspection and testing.
  • In charge of conducting routine Quality System audits for several European agencies such as VDE (Germany) , SEMKO (SWEDEN) , IMQ (ITALY) , under the Secretariat held by the EEPCA [European Electrical Products Certification Association]. Audits were conducted using ISO 9000 standards.

 

Director of Quality Assurance            March 1999 -

SL Waber             September 2000

Nogales, AZ

In charge of providing technical quality engineering support to the operation of 2 manufacturing plants (Nogales, Arizona and Nogales, Mexico) dedicated to produce electronic surge suppressors and temporary power taps.

Coordinated all aspects of the quality assurance program towards design, APQP, development and implementation of a process oriented to the alignment of ISO 9000 compliance, as well as the coordinating efforts to improve inprocess and final product first pass rates.

Responsible for providing training of ISO 9000 compliance, SPC, 8 Disciplines (8Ds) , and continuous improvement (Kaizen) techniques to organization.

Responsible for providing support and direction to decrease the discrepancies' rate and challenges with several safety agencies such as UL, CSA, TUV, etc.

Managed and coordinated the acquisition of new products brought to our facilities in Arizona and Mexico as well as quality evaluations for potential new suppliers.

Developed, monitored, and reported key quality metrics to Top Management.

Responsible for managing and leading Engineering Department as part of a cross training program.
